content:
That's a great idea! Listening to audiobooks or documentaries during your morning runs is an excellent way to make the most of your time and stay engaged. It's fantastic that you've found a way to make your runs more enjoyable.

Audiobooks can be a great way to consume non-fiction content, especially when it comes to history. You can absorb the information while doing something physical, and it can make the learning process more enjoyable.

If you're looking for more audiobook recommendations on World War I, you might want to check out:

* "The World Remade: America in World War I" by G.J. Meyer (narrated by Malcolm Hillgartner)
* "World War I: The Great War" by S.L.A. Marshall (narrated by Grover Gardner)
* "A World Undone: The Story of the Great War, 1914-1918" by G.J. Meyer (narrated by Simon Vance)

These audiobooks are all well-researched and engagingly narrated, making them perfect for your morning runs.

Remember to stay safe while listening to audiobooks during your runs, and enjoy the learning process!
